hint.text: Use quadratic equation for solving the obtained quadratic equation.

solution.text:
Let the radius of the playground be x m.
Therefore,
\(Area = \pi x^2\)
Similarly,
\(Perimeter = 2 \pi x\)
Thus, according to question:
i.e., \( \pi x^2 = _{k}_\times (2 \pi x) + _{{8*k*k}}_\pi \)
i.e., \( \pi x^2 = _{{k*2}}_ \pi x + _{{8*k*k}}_\pi \)
i.e., \( x^2 = _{{k*2}}_x + _{{8*k*k}}_\)
i.e., \( x^2 - _{{k*2}}_x - _{{8*k*k}}_ = 0\)
On comparing with general equation
We get : a = 1 , b = -_{{k*2}}_ and c = -_{{8*k*k}}_
Substituting the values in quadratic formula
i.e., x = \({_{{k*2}}_ \pm \sqrt{_{{k*2}}_^2-4\times 1\times (-_{{8*k*k}}_)}}\over 2\)
i.e., x = \({_{{k*2}}_ \pm \sqrt {_{{pow((k*2),2)}}_+_{{4*8*k*k}}_}}\over 2\)
i.e., x = \({_{{k*2}}_ \pm \sqrt {_{{36*k*k}}_}}\over 2\)
i.e., x = \({_{{k*2}}_ \pm {_{{6*k}}_}}\over 2\)
i.e., x = \({_{{k*2}}_ + {_{{6*k}}_}}\over 2\) and x = \({_{{k*2}}_ - {_{{6*k}}_}}\over 2\)
i.e., x = \(_{{8*k}}_\over 2\) and x = \(-_{{k*4}}_\over 2\)
i.e., x = _{{4*k}}_ and x = -_{{k*2}}_
Since x can not be negative, being a dimension, hence radius of the ground is _{{4*k}}_metre.

content.text: Area of a circular playground(in square metre) is \(_{{8*k*k}}_\pi\) more than _{k}_ times of its perimeter.Find the radius of the playground.
